chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lem D Williams Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lem D Williams Jr in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Lem D Williams Jr.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing. Motion hearing proceeded. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTED defense motion to Sever Counts 1 and 2 for Counts 3, 4, and 5. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 11. Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
State's Response to Defense Motion to Sever and In Support of Joinder, filed.

Defendant Lem D Williams Jr in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Lem D Williams Jr.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status conference.  Defense filed a Motion to Sever Counts 1 and 2 from Counts 3, 4, and 5 and requested motion hearing date.  State's response to be filed on or before 09-30-2022. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Sever Counts 1 and 2 from Counts 3, 4, and 5, filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION and NO POSSESSION of firearms or weapons.

Defendant Lem D Williams in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Lem D Williams in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Defense filed Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail.  Bail motion argued by Defense and GRANTED by the Court.  Defense intends to file a motion.  Court ordered motion to be filed by August 31, 2022.  Case adjourned for a status conference in Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Lem D. Williams, Jr. - #2022009182, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
The state motion to file an amended information with all 5 counts; the court granted the motion and reinstated count 1.  If defense would like count 1 dismissed, a motion to dismiss must be filed.
Bail/bond hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lem D Williams in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Lem D Williams in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for arraignment.  Information filed was rejected as it contained Count 1 which was dismissed.  State filed amended information due to information being rejected over defense's objection.  Court granted states motion to file the amended information.  Defense acknowledged receipt and waived formal reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Defense requested bail review date.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
information filed has been rejected as it contained Count 1 which has been dismissed. State to file an amended information.

Defendant Lem D Williams in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly; both appear by video.  Defendant Lem D Williams in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lem D Williams in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Lem D Williams in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lem D Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  AS TO COUNT 1:  Motion to dismiss by the defense for lack of probable cause, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Count 1 dismissed without prejudice.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 and 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
